Great torrent, thanks!

Maybe I'm just ignorant, but why is it that some BR 1080p rips are 1-2gb and others are fuckin 8g+?
If I'm transferring movies to a flash drive to watch on my 60LED TV what is the best file type/size to get?

@usmckill

Unless compression tech has improved monumentally I don't believe that a full length movie could be only 1-2GB and still be a full 1080p Blu-Ray rip. Reason is because DVD = 4.7GB and Blu-Ray = 25GB, assuming each type is only a single layer disc.

Now a TV show which is only 40-45min in 720p is 1-1.4GB. So I don't see how a 1080p movie could only be 1 or 2GB. 

Please, correct me if I'm wrong.
When i play it back in theres an echo. any ideas?
@hurricanhill Your player is probably playing the two audio streams at the same time, I suggest you to try a better player, like VLC Player or Media Player Classic.

@usmckill The reason these files are smaller is the bitrate of the video stream, these files with 8GB+ has a larger bitrate, the difference it gives it adds more detail to the movie, more crisp quality, but some people cant even notice the diff, while others do.

I suggest you to download this file and watch on your TV if you like the quality maybe you should stick with the smaller files.
